titleInfo.title: Photograph of kiosk for selling war bonds, circa 1942

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219.

mods.abstract: A photograph of a woman seated at a kiosk inside an unidentified building in Nashville, selling Defense Savings Stamps and Bonds. A large Minute Man poster encouraging people to buy bonds is to the left, and several women and a man are lined up to buy bonds at the kiosk. Text on the kiosk is partially visible, reading: "Let's band together for defenseâ€¦Buy Defense Savings Stamps and Bonds." Photograph taken early in World War II, circa 1942. By the end of the war, over 85 million Americans had invested in War Bonds, raising $185.7 billion to finance the war effort. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 3.25 x 4.25 in.
